topics.name: Division with Remainders & Long Division Basics
Multiplication of Fractions by Whole Numbers
Addition and Subtraction of Decimals (Simple Cases)

skills.title: Identify numerals 0-9
skills.desc: Recognize and name the written symbols for numbers zero through nine.

skills.title: Write numerals 0-9
skills.desc: Correctly form the written symbols for numbers zero through nine.

skills.title: Understand one-to-one correspondence when counting
skills.desc: Match each object in a set with a single number word or numeral when counting.

skills.title: Count objects up to 10
skills.desc: Accurately determine the quantity of items in a set containing up to 10 objects.

skills.title: Compare quantities (more/less/equal) up to 10
skills.desc: Determine if one group of up to 10 objects has more, less, or an equal number of items as another group.

skills.title: Count forwards to 20
skills.desc: Recite number sequence from 1 to 20.

skills.title: Count backwards from 10
skills.desc: Recite number sequence from 10 down to 0 or 1.

skills.title: Identify ordinal numbers (e.g., first, second, third) up to 5th
skills.desc: Understand and use terms describing position in a sequence up to fifth.

skills.title: Sequence numbers up to 20
skills.desc: Arrange numbers in correct order from smallest to largest, or vice-versa, up to 20.

skills.title: Understand addition as combining sets
skills.desc: Grasp the concept that addition means putting together groups of items to find a total.

skills.title: Add two single-digit numbers with sums up to 10
skills.desc: Calculate the sum of two numbers, each between 0 and 9, where the total is 10 or less.

skills.title: Add two single-digit numbers with sums up to 20
skills.desc: Calculate the sum of two numbers, each between 0 and 9, where the total is 20 or less.

skills.title: Understand and use the plus (+) and equals (=) signs
skills.desc: Recognize and correctly interpret the symbols for addition and equality.

skills.title: Solve single-step addition word problems (sums to 20)
skills.desc: Interpret and solve story problems requiring addition of numbers with sums up to 20.

skills.title: Understand the commutative property of addition
skills.desc: Recognize that changing the order of addends does not change the sum (e.g., 2+3 = 3+2).

skills.title: Add zero to a number
skills.desc: Understand that adding zero to any number results in that same number.

skills.title: Find a missing addend in sums up to 10
skills.desc: Determine the unknown number in an addition equation where the sum is 10 or less (e.g., 3 + ? = 7).

skills.title: Understand subtraction as taking away or finding the difference
skills.desc: Grasp the concept that subtraction means removing items from a group or comparing two groups.

skills.title: Subtract single-digit numbers from numbers up to 10
skills.desc: Calculate the difference when subtracting a single-digit number from a number 10 or less.

skills.title: Subtract single-digit numbers from numbers up to 20
skills.desc: Calculate the difference when subtracting a single-digit number from a number 20 or less.

skills.title: Understand and use the minus (-) sign
skills.desc: Recognize and correctly interpret the symbol for subtraction.

skills.title: Solve single-step subtraction word problems (within 20)
skills.desc: Interpret and solve story problems requiring subtraction of numbers within 20.

skills.title: Relate subtraction to addition as inverse operations (within 20)
skills.desc: Understand that subtraction can 'undo' addition and use addition facts to solve subtraction problems.

skills.title: Subtract zero from a number
skills.desc: Understand that subtracting zero from any number results in that same number.

skills.title: Subtract a number from itself
skills.desc: Understand that subtracting a number from itself results in zero.

skills.title: Identify tens and ones in a two-digit number
skills.desc: Recognize the place value of each digit in a number from 10 to 99.

skills.title: Represent two-digit numbers using base-ten blocks (or drawings)
skills.desc: Model two-digit numbers using physical or visual representations of tens and ones.

skills.title: Compare two-digit numbers using <, >, =
skills.desc: Determine if one two-digit number is less than, greater than, or equal to another.

skills.title: Understand that the two digits of a two-digit number represent amounts of tens and ones
skills.desc: Grasp the meaning of each digit's position in a two-digit number.

skills.title: Identify hundreds, tens, and ones in a three-digit number
skills.desc: Recognize the place value of each digit in a number from 100 to 999.

skills.title: Represent three-digit numbers using base-ten blocks (or drawings)
skills.desc: Model three-digit numbers using physical or visual representations of hundreds, tens, and ones.

skills.title: Compare three-digit numbers using <, >, =
skills.desc: Determine if one three-digit number is less than, greater than, or equal to another.

skills.title: Add a two-digit number and a one-digit number without regrouping
skills.desc: Sum a two-digit number and a single-digit number where no carrying is required.

skills.title: Add two two-digit numbers without regrouping
skills.desc: Sum two two-digit numbers where no carrying is required in any place value column.

skills.title: Add a two-digit number and a one-digit number with regrouping (carrying)
skills.desc: Sum a two-digit number and a single-digit number where carrying from ones to tens is required.

skills.title: Add two two-digit numbers with regrouping (carrying)
skills.desc: Sum two two-digit numbers where carrying from ones to tens (or tens to hundreds) is required.

skills.title: Add three or more two-digit numbers
skills.desc: Sum a list of three or more two-digit numbers, potentially involving regrouping.

skills.title: Add three-digit numbers with and without regrouping
skills.desc: Sum two or more three-digit numbers, correctly applying regrouping rules.

skills.title: Solve multi-step addition word problems involving multi-digit numbers
skills.desc: Interpret and solve story problems requiring multiple addition operations with multi-digit numbers.

skills.title: Subtract a one-digit number from a two-digit number without regrouping
skills.desc: Find the difference between a two-digit number and a single-digit number where no borrowing is required.

skills.title: Subtract two two-digit numbers without regrouping
skills.desc: Find the difference between two two-digit numbers where no borrowing is required in any place value column.

skills.title: Subtract a one-digit number from a two-digit number with regrouping (borrowing)
skills.desc: Find the difference between a two-digit number and a single-digit number where borrowing from tens to ones is required.

skills.title: Subtract two two-digit numbers with regrouping (borrowing)
skills.desc: Find the difference between two two-digit numbers where borrowing is required.

skills.title: Subtract three-digit numbers with and without regrouping
skills.desc: Find the difference between two three-digit numbers, correctly applying regrouping rules.

skills.title: Subtract across zeros
skills.desc: Perform subtraction when borrowing is required from a place value column containing a zero (e.g., 200 - 37).

skills.title: Solve multi-step subtraction word problems involving multi-digit numbers
skills.desc: Interpret and solve story problems requiring multiple subtraction operations with multi-digit numbers.

skills.title: Understand multiplication as repeated addition
skills.desc: Grasp the concept that multiplying is a shortcut for adding the same number multiple times.

skills.title: Represent multiplication using arrays or equal groups
skills.desc: Model multiplication problems by arranging objects in rows and columns or as sets of equal size.

skills.title: Understand and use the multiplication (x) sign
skills.desc: Recognize and correctly interpret the symbol for multiplication.

skills.title: Memorize/recall multiplication facts up to 10x10
skills.desc: Fluently recall products of two single-digit numbers from 0x0 to 10x10.

skills.title: Understand the commutative property of multiplication
skills.desc: Recognize that changing the order of factors does not change the product (e.g., 2x3 = 3x2).

skills.title: Multiply by 0 and 1
skills.desc: Understand that multiplying any number by 0 results in 0, and by 1 results in the number itself.

skills.title: Solve single-step multiplication word problems
skills.desc: Interpret and solve story problems requiring a single multiplication operation.

skills.title: Multiply a single-digit number by a multiple of 10
skills.desc: Calculate products like 3 x 40 or 7 x 20.

skills.title: Understand division as equal sharing (partitive)
skills.desc: Grasp the concept of dividing a quantity into a known number of equal groups.

skills.title: Understand division as repeated subtraction (measurement/quotitive)
skills.desc: Grasp the concept of finding how many times a smaller number fits into a larger number by subtracting.

skills.title: Understand and use the division (รท) sign
skills.desc: Recognize and correctly interpret the symbol for division.

skills.title: Relate division to multiplication as inverse operations
skills.desc: Understand that division can 'undo' multiplication and use multiplication facts to solve division problems.

skills.title: Perform division with single-digit divisors and dividends (whole number quotients, no remainders)
skills.desc: Calculate quotients for division problems where the answer is a whole number and there is no remainder.

skills.title: Understand division by 1
skills.desc: Recognize that dividing any number by 1 results in the number itself.

skills.title: Understand that division by zero is undefined
skills.desc: Grasp the concept that a number cannot be divided by zero.

skills.title: Solve single-step division word problems (no remainders)
skills.desc: Interpret and solve story problems requiring a single division operation resulting in a whole number.

skills.title: Identify and represent unit fractions (1/2, 1/3, 1/4) of a whole
skills.desc: Recognize and show fractions where the numerator is 1, representing one part of an equally divided whole.

skills.title: Identify and represent non-unit fractions (e.g., 2/3, 3/4) of a whole
skills.desc: Recognize and show fractions where the numerator is greater than 1, representing multiple parts of an equally divided whole.

skills.title: Understand the meaning of numerator and denominator
skills.desc: Identify the top number (numerator) as parts considered and bottom number (denominator) as total equal parts.

skills.title: Compare unit fractions with visual aids
skills.desc: Determine which of two unit fractions is larger or smaller using models or diagrams.

skills.title: Recognize simple equivalent fractions (e.g., 1/2 = 2/4) using models
skills.desc: Identify fractions that represent the same amount using visual representations.

skills.title: Represent fractions on a number line (simple cases)
skills.desc: Locate and plot simple fractions like 1/2, 1/4, 3/4 on a number line between 0 and 1.

skills.title: Compare lengths of objects directly (longer, shorter, taller)
skills.desc: Determine relative lengths by direct visual comparison.

skills.title: Measure length using non-standard units (e.g., paperclips, blocks)
skills.desc: Use everyday objects to quantify the length of another object.

skills.title: Estimate and measure length using standard units (e.g., cm, inches)
skills.desc: Approximate and then accurately measure length using centimeters or inches.

skills.title: Compare weights of objects directly (heavier, lighter)
skills.desc: Determine relative weights by direct comparison, e.g., holding them or using a simple balance.

skills.title: Tell and write time to the hour using analog and digital clocks
skills.desc: Read and record time when the minute hand is on the 12.

skills.title: Tell and write time to the half-hour using analog and digital clocks
skills.desc: Read and record time when the minute hand is on the 6.

skills.title: Identify common coins (penny, nickel, dime, quarter) and their values
skills.desc: Recognize US coins and state their respective cent values.

skills.title: Count combinations of pennies, nickels, and dimes
skills.desc: Calculate the total value of a collection of pennies, nickels, and dimes.

skills.title: Round whole numbers to the nearest 10
skills.desc: Determine the multiple of 10 closest to a given whole number.

skills.title: Round whole numbers to the nearest 100
skills.desc: Determine the multiple of 100 closest to a given whole number.

skills.title: Round whole numbers to the nearest 1000
skills.desc: Determine the multiple of 1000 closest to a given whole number.

skills.title: Estimate sums of two-digit numbers by rounding
skills.desc: Approximate the sum of two 2-digit numbers by rounding each to the nearest 10 before adding.

skills.title: Estimate sums of three-digit numbers by rounding
skills.desc: Approximate the sum of two 3-digit numbers by rounding each to the nearest 100 before adding.

skills.title: Estimate differences of two-digit numbers by rounding
skills.desc: Approximate the difference of two 2-digit numbers by rounding each to the nearest 10 before subtracting.

skills.title: Estimate differences of three-digit numbers by rounding
skills.desc: Approximate the difference of two 3-digit numbers by rounding each to the nearest 100 before subtracting.

skills.title: Use estimation to check reasonableness of answers (add/sub)
skills.desc: Compare an estimated sum/difference to a calculated one to verify if the calculation is plausible.

skills.title: Estimate products by rounding factors
skills.desc: Approximate the product of two numbers by rounding one or both factors before multiplying.

skills.title: Estimate quotients by using compatible numbers
skills.desc: Approximate a quotient by finding numbers close to the dividend/divisor that divide easily.

skills.title: Identify and apply the associative property of addition
skills.desc: Recognize and use (a+b)+c = a+(b+c) to simplify addition.

skills.title: Identify and apply the associative property of multiplication
skills.desc: Recognize and use (axb)xc = ax(bxc) to simplify multiplication.

skills.title: Identify and apply the distributive property of multiplication over addition
skills.desc: Recognize and use ax(b+c) = (axb)+(axc).

skills.title: Understand the identity property of multiplication (a x 1 = a)
skills.desc: Recognize that any number multiplied by 1 remains unchanged; identify 1 as multiplicative identity.

skills.title: Understand the identity property of addition (a + 0 = a)
skills.desc: Recognize that any number added to 0 remains unchanged; identify 0 as additive identity.

skills.title: Identify factors of a whole number
skills.desc: List all whole numbers that can be multiplied to get a given number (e.g., factors of 12).

skills.title: Identify multiples of a single-digit number
skills.desc: List numbers obtained by multiplying a single-digit number by consecutive whole numbers (e.g., multiples of 3).

skills.title: Determine if a whole number is a multiple of another single-digit number
skills.desc: Check if a whole number can be evenly divided by a single-digit number.

skills.title: Identify common factors of two whole numbers
skills.desc: List factors shared by two different whole numbers.

skills.title: Identify common multiples of two whole numbers
skills.desc: List multiples shared by two different whole numbers.

skills.title: Understand prime and composite numbers (basic introduction)
skills.desc: Distinguish numbers with exactly two factors (prime) from those with more (composite).

skills.title: Multiply a two-digit number by a one-digit number (with regrouping)
skills.desc: Calculate product of a 2-digit and 1-digit number, involving carrying (e.g., 24 x 3).

skills.title: Multiply a three-digit number by a one-digit number (with regrouping)
skills.desc: Calculate product of a 3-digit and 1-digit number, involving carrying (e.g., 124 x 3).

skills.title: Multiply two two-digit numbers
skills.desc: Calculate product of two 2-digit numbers (e.g., 24 x 13).

skills.title: Solve multi-step word problems involving multi-digit multiplication
skills.desc: Interpret and solve story problems requiring multiple multiplication steps with multi-digit numbers.

skills.title: Perform division with single-digit divisors resulting in a remainder
skills.desc: Divide a number by a single-digit number where the division is not exact, identifying the remainder.

skills.title: Interpret the meaning of a remainder in a division word problem
skills.desc: Understand what the leftover amount represents in the context of a story problem.

skills.title: Divide a two-digit number by a one-digit number (long division steps, no remainder)
skills.desc: Use the long division algorithm for 2-digit dividends and 1-digit divisors, resulting in no remainder.

skills.title: Divide a two-digit number by a one-digit number (long division steps, with remainder)
skills.desc: Use the long division algorithm for 2-digit dividends and 1-digit divisors, resulting in a remainder.

skills.title: Divide a three-digit number by a one-digit number (long division steps, with/without remainder)
skills.desc: Use long division for 3-digit dividends and 1-digit divisors.

skills.title: Solve multi-step word problems involving division with remainders
skills.desc: Interpret and solve story problems requiring division where remainders must be considered.

skills.title: Compare fractions with like numerators
skills.desc: Determine which fraction is larger/smaller when numerators are same but denominators differ (e.g., 2/5 vs 2/3).

skills.title: Compare fractions with like denominators
skills.desc: Determine which fraction is larger/smaller when denominators are same but numerators differ (e.g., 2/5 vs 3/5).

skills.title: Compare fractions to benchmarks (1/2, 1)
skills.desc: Determine if a fraction is less than, greater than, or equal to 1/2 or 1.

skills.title: Find common denominators for two simple fractions
skills.desc: Identify a common multiple for the denominators of two fractions (e.g., for 1/2 and 1/3, use 6).

skills.title: Compare fractions with unlike denominators by finding a common denominator
skills.desc: Rewrite fractions with a common denominator to compare them.

skills.title: Order a set of simple fractions
skills.desc: Arrange three or more fractions (like/unlike denominators) from least to greatest or vice-versa.

skills.title: Generate equivalent fractions by multiplying numerator and denominator by the same number
skills.desc: Create an equal fraction by scaling up (e.g., 1/2 = 2/4 = 3/6).

skills.title: Generate equivalent fractions by dividing numerator and denominator by a common factor
skills.desc: Create an equal fraction by scaling down (e.g., 6/9 = 2/3).

skills.title: Simplify fractions to their lowest terms
skills.desc: Reduce a fraction by dividing numerator and denominator by their greatest common factor.

skills.title: Identify improper fractions
skills.desc: Recognize fractions where the numerator is greater than or equal to the denominator.

skills.title: Identify mixed numbers
skills.desc: Recognize numbers composed of a whole number and a proper fraction.

skills.title: Convert improper fractions to mixed numbers
skills.desc: Change an improper fraction into an equivalent whole number and proper fraction (e.g., 7/3 to 2 1/3).

skills.title: Convert mixed numbers to improper fractions
skills.desc: Change a mixed number into an equivalent fraction where numerator is larger than denominator (e.g., 2 1/3 to 7/3).

skills.title: Represent improper fractions and mixed numbers on a number line
skills.desc: Locate and plot improper fractions and mixed numbers on a number line beyond 1.

skills.title: Add fractions with like denominators
skills.desc: Sum two or more fractions that share the same denominator.

skills.title: Subtract fractions with like denominators
skills.desc: Find the difference between two fractions that share the same denominator.

skills.title: Add fractions with unlike denominators (simple cases)
skills.desc: Sum two fractions with different denominators by first finding a common denominator (e.g., halves and fourths).

skills.title: Subtract fractions with unlike denominators (simple cases)
skills.desc: Subtract two fractions with different denominators by first finding a common denominator.

skills.title: Add mixed numbers with like denominators (no regrouping)
skills.desc: Sum two mixed numbers where fraction parts have same denominator and sum of fractions is less than 1.

skills.title: Subtract mixed numbers with like denominators (no regrouping)
skills.desc: Subtract mixed numbers where fraction parts have same denominator and minuend fraction is larger.

skills.title: Solve word problems involving addition/subtraction of fractions with like denominators
skills.desc: Interpret and solve story problems requiring addition or subtraction of like-denominator fractions.

skills.title: Understand multiplication of a fraction by a whole number as repeated addition
Multiply a unit fraction by a whole number
skills.desc: Calculate the product of a whole number and a fraction with numerator 1 (e.g., 5 x 1/3).

skills.title: Multiply a non-unit fraction by a whole number
skills.desc: Calculate the product of a whole number and a fraction with numerator >1 (e.g., 4 x 2/3).

skills.title: Solve word problems involving multiplication of a fraction by a whole number
skills.desc: Interpret and solve story problems requiring multiplication of a fraction by a whole number.

skills.title: Understand tenths as fractions with a denominator of 10
skills.desc: Recognize that one tenth is 1 part out of 10 equal parts of a whole (1/10).

skills.title: Understand hundredths as fractions with a denominator of 100
skills.desc: Recognize that one hundredth is 1 part out of 100 equal parts of a whole (1/100).

skills.title: Read and write decimals to the tenths place
skills.desc: Correctly say and write numbers like 0.7 or 2.3.

skills.title: Read and write decimals to the hundredths place
skills.desc: Correctly say and write numbers like 0.07 or 2.35.

skills.title: Relate tenths to decimal notation (e.g., 3/10 = 0.3)
skills.desc: Convert fractions with denominator 10 to their decimal equivalents and vice-versa.

skills.title: Relate hundredths to decimal notation (e.g., 27/100 = 0.27)
skills.desc: Convert fractions with denominator 100 to their decimal equivalents and vice-versa.

skills.title: Identify the place value of digits in decimals to the hundredths place
skills.desc: Recognize the value of digits in the tenths and hundredths positions.

skills.title: Represent decimals using models (e.g., base-ten blocks, grids)
skills.desc: Visually show decimal quantities using area models or base-ten representations.

skills.title: Compare decimals to the tenths place
skills.desc: Determine if one decimal (e.g., 0.4) is <, >, or = to another decimal (e.g., 0.6) in tenths.

skills.title: Compare decimals to the hundredths place
skills.desc: Determine if one decimal (e.g., 0.45) is <, >, or = to another decimal (e.g., 0.42) in hundredths.

skills.title: Order a set of decimals (tenths and hundredths)
skills.desc: Arrange three or more decimals from least to greatest or vice-versa.

skills.title: Relate decimals to money (e.g., $0.50 is 50 hundredths)
skills.desc: Understand and represent monetary values using decimal notation.

skills.title: Add decimals to the tenths place (no regrouping)
skills.desc: Sum two decimals written to tenths where no carrying is required (e.g., 0.2 + 0.5).

skills.title: Add decimals to the hundredths place (no regrouping, often related to money)
skills.desc: Sum two decimals to hundredths where no carrying is required (e.g., $0.25 + $0.50).

skills.title: Subtract decimals to the tenths place (no regrouping)
skills.desc: Subtract two decimals to tenths where no borrowing is required (e.g., 0.7 - 0.3).

skills.title: Subtract decimals to the hundredths place (no regrouping, often related to money)
skills.desc: Subtract two decimals to hundredths where no borrowing is required (e.g., $0.75 - $0.20).

skills.title: Tell and write time to the nearest five minutes
skills.desc: Read and record time on analog/digital clocks when minute hand points to numbers on clock face.

skills.title: Tell and write time to the nearest minute
skills.desc: Read and record time on analog/digital clocks with precision to the exact minute.

skills.title: Understand and use AM and PM
skills.desc: Distinguish between times in the morning/afternoon/evening using AM (ante meridiem) and PM (post meridiem).

skills.title: Calculate elapsed time in hours
skills.desc: Determine the duration between two times when measured in full hours (e.g., 2:00 to 5:00 is 3 hours).

skills.title: Calculate elapsed time in minutes (within the hour)
skills.desc: Determine the duration between two times, in minutes, when both times are within the same hour.

skills.title: Know units of time (seconds, minutes, hours, days, weeks, months, years)
skills.desc: Recognize and name standard units for measuring time and their general relationships.

skills.title: Convert between units of time (simple conversions)
skills.desc: Change from one unit of time to another (e.g., 120 minutes to 2 hours, 3 days to weeks).

skills.title: Count collections of coins including quarters
skills.desc: Calculate the total value of a collection of pennies, nickels, dimes, and quarters.

skills.title: Make change from $1.00
skills.desc: Determine the correct amount of coins to return as change from one dollar for a purchase less than $1.00.

skills.title: Solve word problems involving adding and subtracting money amounts (with decimals)
skills.desc: Interpret and solve story problems requiring addition or subtraction of money values written in decimal form.

skills.title: Represent money amounts using dollar and cent notation
skills.desc: Write monetary values correctly using $ symbol and decimal point (e.g., $5.25).

skills.title: Compare capacities directly (holds more, holds less)
skills.desc: Determine which of two containers can hold more or less liquid by visual inspection or direct comparison.

skills.title: Measure capacity using non-standard units (e.g., cups, scoops)
skills.desc: Use everyday objects to quantify how much a container can hold.

skills.title: Identify standard units of liquid volume (e.g., liter, cup, gallon - recognition)
skills.desc: Recognize common units used for measuring liquid volume.

skills.title: Estimate liquid volumes
skills.desc: Approximate the amount a container holds using standard units without precise measurement.

skills.title: Measure weight/mass using non-standard units
skills.desc: Use everyday objects (e.g., blocks) to compare or quantify the weight of other objects.

skills.title: Identify standard units of weight/mass (e.g., gram, pound - recognition)
skills.desc: Recognize common units used for measuring weight or mass.

skills.title: Estimate weights/masses
skills.desc: Approximate the weight/mass of an object using standard units without precise measurement.

skills.title: Understand temperature as a measure of hotness or coldness
skills.desc: Grasp the basic concept of what temperature indicates.

skills.title: Read a thermometer (Celsius and Fahrenheit, basic increments)
skills.desc: Determine the temperature shown on a thermometer scale in degrees Celsius or Fahrenheit.

skills.title: Understand perimeter as the distance around a shape
skills.desc: Grasp the concept that perimeter is the total length of the boundary of a 2D figure.

skills.title: Find the perimeter of a polygon by adding side lengths
skills.desc: Calculate the perimeter of a shape with straight sides by summing the lengths of all its sides.

skills.title: Understand area as the measure of surface covered by a shape
skills.desc: Grasp the concept that area quantifies the 2D space a flat shape occupies.

skills.title: Find the area of a rectangle by counting unit squares
skills.desc: Determine the area of a rectangular region by counting the number of same-sized squares that cover it.

skills.title: Find the area of a rectangle by multiplying side lengths (whole numbers)
skills.desc: Calculate area of a rectangle using the formula length ร width, with whole number dimensions.

skills.title: Identify common 2D shapes
skills.desc: Recognize and name shapes like circle, square, rectangle, triangle, hexagon, pentagon, rhombus, trapezoid.

skills.title: Describe attributes of 2D shapes (number of sides, number of vertices/corners)
skills.desc: Identify and state key properties of 2D shapes, such as how many sides or corners they have.

skills.title: Sort 2D shapes based on attributes
skills.desc: Group 2D shapes according to shared properties like number of sides or presence of right angles.

skills.title: Identify lines, line segments, rays, and angles (right, acute, obtuse - basic recognition)
skills.desc: Recognize basic geometric elements and types of angles by sight.

skills.title: Identify parallel and perpendicular lines (basic recognition)
skills.desc: Distinguish between lines that never meet (parallel) and lines that meet at a right angle (perpendicular).

skills.title: Identify common 3D shapes
skills.desc: Recognize and name shapes like cube, sphere, cone, cylinder, rectangular prism, pyramid.

skills.title: Describe attributes of 3D shapes (number of faces, edges, vertices - for simple shapes like cubes)
skills.desc: Identify and state key properties of 3D shapes, such as flat surfaces, straight edges, and points.

skills.title: Relate 2D shapes to faces of 3D shapes
skills.desc: Recognize the 2D shapes that form the flat surfaces (faces) of 3D objects.

skills.title: Collect data using surveys or observations
skills.desc: Gather information by asking questions or by watching and recording events.

skills.title: Organize data using tally marks
skills.desc: Use tally marks as a simple method to count and record frequencies of data points.

skills.title: Create a simple picture graph from data
skills.desc: Represent data visually using symbols or pictures where each symbol stands for one or more units.

skills.title: Create a simple bar graph from data (with scaled intervals)
skills.desc: Represent data using rectangular bars of lengths proportional to the values they represent, possibly with a scale.

skills.title: Create a line plot to represent measurement data
skills.desc: Display data frequencies along a number line using X's or dots over corresponding values.

skills.title: Read and interpret data from a picture graph
skills.desc: Understand and extract information presented in a picture graph, including using a key.

skills.title: Read and interpret data from a bar graph
skills.desc: Understand and extract information from a bar graph, including comparing bar lengths and reading scales.

skills.title: Read and interpret data from a line plot
skills.desc: Understand and extract information from a line plot, including finding most frequent values or range.

skills.title: Solve simple problems using information presented in graphs
skills.desc: Answer questions (e.g., 'how many more', 'total') based on data shown in picture graphs, bar graphs, or line plots.

skills.title: Identify steps for two-step word problems (add/sub)
skills.desc: Determine the sequence of two operations (addition and/or subtraction) needed to solve a story problem.

skills.title: Solve two-step word problems (add/sub)
skills.desc: Perform the necessary calculations to find the solution to two-step story problems involving + or -.

skills.title: Identify steps for two-step word problems (mult/div with others)
skills.desc: Determine sequence of two operations (mult/div with add/sub) needed to solve a story problem.

skills.title: Solve two-step word problems (mult/div with others)
skills.desc: Perform calculations for two-step story problems involving x, รท, +, or -.

skills.title: Choose the correct operation(s) for a word problem
skills.desc: Analyze a word problem to select the appropriate arithmetic operation(s) to find the solution.
